Key.Original: Advanced Integrated Radio System (AIRS) could not load an extension. Check the newest diagnostic report (.RPT) file in "%localappdata%/Arma 3" for more information about what caused this issue. If you continue to run the game without the extension avaliable, you will encounter many errors that cause instability. You will need to restart your game to fix this issue.
Key.English: Advanced Integrated Radio System (AIRS) could not load an extension. Check the newest diagnostic report (.RPT) file in "%localappdata%/Arma 3" for more information about what caused this issue. If you continue to run the game without the extension avaliable, you will encounter many errors that cause instability. You will need to restart your game to fix this issue.

Key.Original: This is the device which will be used as the input device for audio.\nTo change this setting go to the Windows Sound Control Panel, select the 'Recording' tab, then select and set the desired device as the 'Default Communication Device'.\nChanges to the default device may cause issues if the game is not restarted.
Key.English: This is the device which will be used as the input device for audio.\nTo change this setting go to the Windows Sound Control Panel, select the 'Recording' tab, then select and set the desired device as the 'Default Communication Device'.\nChanges to the default device may cause issues if the game is not restarted.

Key.Original:
How your direct 3D audio will be transmitted.
Push-To-Talk - Voice data is only transmitted when your PTT key is pressed.
Voice Activation Detection - Automatically transmit voice data when audio passes the defined volume gate.
Continuous Transmission - All voice data will be continously transmitted even if you are not speaking.
Key.English:
How your direct 3D audio will be transmitted.
Push-To-Talk - Voice data is only transmitted when your PTT key is pressed.
Voice Activation Detection - Automatically transmit voice data when audio passes the defined volume gate.
Continuous Transmission - All voice data will be continously transmitted even if you are not speaking.

Key.Original: When using Voice Activation Detection or if specifically enabled for Push-To-Talk, audio data will only be transmitted if the volume of the audio is above the value set in the Volume Gate slider.
Key.English: When using Voice Activation Detection or if specifically enabled for Push-To-Talk, audio data will only be transmitted if the volume of the audio is above the value set in the Volume Gate slider.

Key.Original: Increase or decrease the volume of your microphone, this effect is applied before the volume is checked against the volume gate.
Key.English: Increase or decrease the volume of your microphone, this effect is applied before the volume is checked against the volume gate.

Key.Original: Play the incoming audio from your input device back through your speakers.\nIf playing without headphones this may cause a feedback loop between your speakers and microphone.
Key.English: Play the incoming audio from your input device back through your speakers.\nIf playing without headphones this may cause a feedback loop between your speakers and microphone.

Key.Original: Units that are speaking will continuously move their lips as if they are talking to simulate lip syncing between the audio and the unit's mouth.\nWill also make it easier to distinguish who is talking in a group.
Key.English: Units that are speaking will continuously move their lips as if they are talking to simulate lip syncing between the audio and the unit's mouth.\nWill also make it easier to distinguish who is talking in a group.

Key.Original: Delay the ending of transmitting audio when the Push-To-Talk key is released.
Key.English: Delay the ending of transmitting audio when the Push-To-Talk key is released.
